page.title: 13THE PRISON, RANBY
page.content: Construction work began in 1970 and the prison, which holds approximately 150, was opened on December 12th 1971. The prison stands just to the north of the A620, lying parallel with the 'Ranby straight'. It has modern buildings, surrounded by a high wire fence, but does not have the formidable appearance of top security prisons. Within the prison considerable efforts are made to educate and re-educate the inmates. It employs a large number of warders and ancillary staff, so making an important contribution to the economy of the area.
